title: Cross compiling for Raspberry Pi doesn't work
body:
I tested cross compiling for Raspberry Pi with a helloworld, it worked, but for my real program it doesn't work:
```
$ cargo b --release --target=armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf
   Compiling libc v0.2.36
   Compiling cfg-if v0.1.2
   Compiling byteorder v1.2.1
   Compiling lazy_static v1.0.0
   Compiling num-traits v0.1.42
   Compiling lazycell v0.6.0
   Compiling utf8-ranges v1.0.0
   Compiling quote v0.3.15
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `compiler_builtins`

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
error: Could not compile `cfg-if`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `std`
  |
  = note: the `armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf` target may not be installed

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `std`
  |
  = note: the `armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf` target may not be installed

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
error: Could not compile `libc`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: Could not compile `lazycell`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `std`
  |
  = note: the `armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf` target may not be installed

error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
error[E0463]: can't find crate for `std`
  |
  = note: the `armv7-unknown-linux-gnueabihf` target may not be installed

error: Could not compile `byteorder`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: aborting due to previous error

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`.
error: Could not compile `num-traits`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```
The target **is** installed. How can I make it work? :)
